intro: Echium rosulatum subsp. rosulatum, commonly known as the clustered fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact rosette of blue-green leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in the summer months. The plant belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its medicinal and ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The species is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
